item.title: Not Mine
item.dc:creator: jessica
item.description:
Dear Friends, I am so tired of having conversations or taking part in anything that does not belong to me. Is that messed up? Selfish, even? You might think so at first, but what I’m saying has a lot of truth to it. I just got home from an author event where the only cute guy there who took interest in asking me normal questions about my life inevitably has a girlfriend. He did not bring this up until we […]

The post Not Mine appeared first on Jessica Barraco.

item.title: Natural Woman
item.dc:creator: jessica
item.description:
Dear Friends, Looking at the beautiful city skyline right now, I can only think of one thing tonight. Natural beauty. What makes all of us feel like natural women? What brings the eu naturele out in all of us? For me, it’s definitely not nature itself. I am a city girl through and through. I think what makes me feel the most beautiful is confidence, strength, and some YSL mascara. Moroccan oil once a week doesn’t hurt either. But seriously, […]

The post Natural Woman appeared first on Jessica Barraco.

item.title: Singles: Don’t mope on Valentine’s Day
item.dc:creator: jessica
item.description:
Originally published in the Denver Post [source] On Sunday, couples will celebrate Valentine’s Day with cards, flowers, sweets and intimate dates. Singles will bide their time till Monday. The highly publicized day for sweethearts can cause a self-esteem blow to those who are unattached. While some try to avoid it or revel in “Single Awareness Day” activities instead, the best way to deal with it is to learn how to romance yourself, relationship experts say. “I remember when I made […]

The post Singles: Don’t mope on Valentine’s Day appeared first on Jessica Barraco.
